Sure. Ive enclosed a few items:
1. A sample illustration showing what an Associates income looks like being run through MBO. 2. You can view some of the types of expenses that are non-billable but can be submitted to MBO for a tax deduction (reducing gross pay) http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Partners_Expense_List.pdf a. The out of pocket business and medical expenses would be paid initially by the Associate, they would then submit that as an expense into our system (upload a receipt) and then when they pay themselves from their Business Center within MBO, we reduce their taxable income by the amount of the expense. MBO owns the liability for that expense (we have a team that reviews them to make sure they are compliant). At the end of the year, those expenses submitted to MBO would not be submitted to the IRS by the Associate (since they already received the same tax benefit by submitting them to us).
We can walk through the estimate and I can answer questions for you. Look forward to our conversation.
Steve
